item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, September 8, 2024 at 8:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Creating a search engine for fun and because Google sucks (34 points | 19 comments)
2. An open discussion forum for ArXiv papers (16 points | 2 comments)
3. Asking the Wrong Questions (2017) (110 points | 48 comments)
4. Baiting the bot (48 points | 22 comments)
5. WebP: The WebPage Compression Format (381 points | 140 comments)
6. Gnome Files: A detailed UI examination (172 points | 72 comments)
7. Cracking an old ZIP file to help open source the ANC's "Vula" secret crypto code (175 points | 18 comments)
8. Microui+fenster=Small GUI (65 points | 7 comments)
9. Why OpenStack and Kata Containers are both seeing a resurgence of adoption (8 points | discuss)
10. Pick Your Distributed Poison (81 points | 11 comments)
11. Appalachian Trail Hiker Photo Archive (83 points | 18 comments)
12. CitizenDJ – Make music using free audio and video from the Library of Congress (123 points | 6 comments)
13. A new rare high-rank elliptic curve, and an orchard of Diophantine equations (160 points | 10 comments)
14. Minimal Web (14 points | 7 comments)
15. Dogs can remember names of toys years after not seeing them, study shows (225 points | 108 comments)
16. Keyhole – Forge own Windows Store licenses (528 points | 247 comments)
17. FutureRack: Server racks are everywhere. Now you can find them in your home (31 points | 16 comments)
18. The "email is authentication" pattern (187 points | 267 comments)
19. GPT-fabricated scientific papers on Google Scholar (128 points | 71 comments)
20. Early science and stone engineering in Menga, a Neolithic dolmen (4 points | discuss)
21. Battlestar Galactica: Technical Manual (2005) (18 points | 5 comments)
22. Things to know about the Great Wave (217 points | 65 comments)
23. WordPerfect for Unix Character Terminals (9 points | 1 comment)
24. Groups underpin modern math (61 points | 30 comments)
25. Beyond Ctrl-C: The dark corners of Unix signal handling (76 points | 34 comments)
26. Hallelujah, Leonard Cohen, and a Pulitzer Prize-winning writer's suicide (130 points | 70 comments)
27. Against Rereading (53 points | 37 comments)
28. How to wrap a C compiler and preprocessor, really (44 points | 1 comment)
29. (Fixing) Determinism in Robotics Testing (10 points | 7 comments)
30. Abstract Debuggers: Exploring Program Behaviors Using Static Analysis Results [pdf] (21 points | discuss)
